quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Pam] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Dwight hands Jim a piece of paper] Oh, what's this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is a demerit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [reads demerit] "Jim Halpert, tardiness." Ugh. I love it already.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You've gotta learn, Jim. You are second in command, but that does not put you above the law.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I understand. And I also have lots of questions, like, what does a demerit mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [scoffs] Let's put it this way. You do not want to receive three of those.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Lay it on me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Three demerits and you'll receive a citation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Now that sounds serious.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, it is serious. Five citations and you're looking at a violation. Four of those and you'll receive a verbal warning. Keep it up, and you're looking at a written warning. Two of those, that'll land you in a world of hurt... in the form of a disciplinary review written up by me and placed on the desk of my immediate superior.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Which would be me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is correct.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, I want a copy on my desk by the end of the day or you will receive a full disadulation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What's a dis... what's that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, you don't want to know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [door opens] Hey, Phyllis. You all right?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I think I just got flashed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What? Really?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: In the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [jumps out of his chair and runs for the door] Move!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, I'll call the real police.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What happened? What can I do to help?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on the phone] OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'll check the web.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on the phone] Thank you. [hangs up the phone] The police are on it. They say they've already had three calls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [to Phyllis] Can you tell us what happened?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Um... I was walking to the building and this man asked me for directions. And he was holding a map. And when I walked over, he had it out... on the map.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Phyllis. You're a married woman.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: The guy was just hanging brain. I mean, what's all the fuss?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: If that's flashing, then lock me up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] It's just, like, so creepy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [whispering] Yeah. [Pam and Ryan whispering]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's happening?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, some guy exposed himself to Phyllis in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? Is she OK?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, Bob Vance took her for a walk to calm down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. [deep breath] Phyllis, you say? [snorts] Hmm. [suppressed laugher]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is so funny?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... I mean did he even see Pam? Or, uh... Karen from behind?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm guessing not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughing softly] I'm sorry. It's pretty funny when you think about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm... not really, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's disgusting and demeaning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, OK. Masters of comedy. A guy dropped his pants. Have you ever been to the circus? [everyone glares] OK. [Michael puts his finger through his pant's zipper] He's back! [laughs] OK. Hmm. [babbling with his coat pulled closed] Waagh! [flashes everyone]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, what's going on? There's a police car in the...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What? Oh. [makes descending scale noise as his finger goes down]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, Phyllis got flashed. It's, uh... [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I don't think laughing about it is an appropriate response.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, come on.  We are laughing at Phyllis, but she's not even here, so no harm, no foul.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I don't think the women in this office -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Incidentally, where were you during all of this? Maybe you're the flasher.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I was at a parent-teacher conference.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-huh. Prove it. Let's see your penis. [everyone is shocked] [exhales]I... you know, as that was coming out of my mouth, I knew that it was wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: In all the excitement, I forgot that my primary goal is to keep people safe. Women can't have fun if they don't feel safe. For example, Jan and I have a safe word in case things go too far. Foliage. And if one of us says that word, the other one has to stop. Although last time... she pretended she didn't hear me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [on speakerphone] Michael, ...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ...come over after work tonight, OK? I miss your body.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know. I feel... I drive a lot. I'm spending a fortune on gas and tolls -

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I'll give you $200. And if I get up before you, I'll leave it on the dresser.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, that... I don't know. That makes me kind of uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I... uh, well, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You know whatever. Just let my assistant know if you're coming over so he can get more vodka, OK? Hunter, are you on?

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.line: [on speakerphone] You got it, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Employees of this office are very small and delicate. Deserve  protection from local pervs. Better 1,000 innocent men are locked up than one guilty man roam free.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [exhales] I am sick over this thing. Those people out there are clearly afraid. And that can't happen. Not in my house.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Agreed. Let me show you what I've been working on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [lays a folder full of pictures on Michael's desk] There are several penises there I'd love Phyllis to run her eyes over. You know, see if we can catch this pervert.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is the last thing that Phyllis needs to see right now, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Look at that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight, are those your pants? That's a Polaroid. [Dwight takes the Polaroid and crumples it in his hand]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Attention, everybody. Dwight has something he would like to say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Due to a recent incident involving Phyllis, a man, a map, and his penis - I think you know what I'm referring to - Michael has authorized me to form an emergency anti-flashing task force.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [raises hand] Question. Won't that interfere with your other task forces?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Answer: No, because this is being given priority one. This is a petition for the business park to upgrade their security cameras as well as install two floodlights in the parking lot. And I know... I know what you're thinking. [Pam nods] Won't that just shed more light on the penises? But that is a risk we have to take. Pam. You can draw, kind of. Why don't you work with  Phallus on drawing a picture of the exposer that I can post around the community?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Phallus?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Phyllis, sorry. I've got penises on the brain. Back to work, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't often miss Roy. But I can tell you one thing. I wish someone had flashed me when I was with Roy. Because that would have been the ass-kicking of the year. [small laugh] Especially if it had been Jim. He would not have wanted me to have seen Jim's... Whoo, I am... I am saying a lot of things.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I didn't really get a good look.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's OK. I don't feel like answering phones.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey, did you guys see this memo that Dwight sent out? [reads memo] "Women will be sent home if they wear makeup or heels exceeding 1/4 inch. Females are not allowed to speak to strangers unless given written authorization by Dwight Schrute." This is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Attention. I am removing all bananas from the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Dwight, this memo that you distributed is insulting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Desperate times call for desperate measures.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [reads memo] "Sleeves down to the wrists, buttoned-up collars, and muted colors." Nobody dress like that. [camera pans over to Angela]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, you know something, Dwight? We are not the terrorists. Why don't you just take these women, put 'em in a burlap sack, and hit 'em with a stick? Because that's what you're doing. I celebrate these women. They deserve the right to dress as they please. If Pam wants to show more cleavage, she should be able to. I encourage that.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Look, it's really simple. We just want you guys to treat us with respect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: See? That's what we're talking about. Did you hear that, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes. Did you hear that, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Dwight. Respect. R-E-S-P-svee-T. Find out what it means to me. All right, you know what? That's it. Conference room, five minutes. Women's appreciation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait a second, how are you qualified for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, I don't know, James. Did I come from a woman? Have I slept with a woman? More than one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [eating banana] Mm, less than three.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is not current.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? Why doesn't Oscar run the meeting? He's a homosexual.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why don't you run the meeting? You play with dolls.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Those are collectible action figures and they're worth more than your car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what? I am the expert. I will conduct it. I know the crap out of women.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I, um... would like to apologize for all of the men who thought this was a laughing matter.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Are we still discussing this? I say again, what is the big deal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nobody likes to be flashed. When Meredith flashed me at that Christmas party, I nearly vomited.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I don't remember doing that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, no catfights. Please. Let's - my point is... my point is... a penis, when seen in the right context, is the most wonderful sight for a woman. But in the wrong context, it is like a monster movie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Alien. Blagh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are...? Shut it. Shut. Up. OK, so what I want to engage us in today is a hardcore discussion about women's problems and issues and situations. Magazines and TV shows and movies portray women as skinny, tall goddesses. Well, look around. Are women like that? No. No, they are not. [points to Pam] Even the hot ones aren't really that skinny. So what does that say? That says that you women are up against it. And it is criminal. Society doesn't care. Society sucks. I don't even consider myself a part of society. FYI. Because I am so angry over all of this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: If it were up to me, you ladies would be the fashion models.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes, Andy. Then the fashion models could come here and work with me.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: What you're saying is extremely misogynistic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. Thank you. That was not necessary, but I appreciated it. And I proves my point. Women can do anything.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I'm saying that you're being sexist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. I'm being misogynistic. That is insane. I am not being sexist.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: That - it's the same thing.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: When I got my hair cut short, you asked me if I was a lesbian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because wha... that was one possible explanation as to why you got that haircut.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And when we get mad, you always ask us if we're on our periods.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have to know whether you're serious or not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I wish I could menstruate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If I could menstruate, I wouldn't have to deal with idiotic calendars anymore. I'd just be able to count down from my previous cycle. Plus, I'd be more in tune with the moon and the tides.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Can we just get back to work?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ye - OK, yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This is not work talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're right. You're right, you're right. And you know why? It's because of where we are. This is a masculine environment. We need to find a place where you feel comfortable. You know where we're gonna go? The Steamtown Mall. [Kelly gasps]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Frankly, it's kind of insulting. But I have a bunch of stuff I need to return in my car. So... I could do that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Malls are just awful and humiliating. They're just store after store of these horrible salespeople making a big fuss out of an adult shopping in a junior's section. There are petite adults who are sort of... smaller who need to wear... maybe a kids' size 10.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, let's go, ladies of Dunder-Mifflin. Hey, we should have a calendar printed up. Pam, put that in my good idea folder. [Pam nods] Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Have you finished with the sketch?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hmm, doesn't seem like the type.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, Phyllis got a good look.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Pam's sketch looks like Dwight with a mustache, but without his glasses] I plan on plastering this pervert's face everywhere. You can run, but you cannot hide.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [tires screeching] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Meredith, slow down! We're not gonna get there any faster if we're dead.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Thanks. I know how to drive. [dumps the crumbs from a bag of chips she was eating into her mouth and throws it out the window]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. You really shouldn't litter.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: My car, my rules.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey, Jim. You wanna go in the women's bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. Thank you, though.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You aren't curious?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not really. I've seen a bathroom before.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, but... it's every guy's fantasy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think you mean a girl's locker room. And in the fantasy, there's usually girls in it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [quietly] Yeah. I'm going in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Go crazy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [in women's bathroom] Oh... my... God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I really appreciate your letting me work alongside you so closely today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Of course you do, moon face. That's because you're a preppy freak, you're the office pariah, and nobody likes you. So start hanging these all around the building.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This guy looks like a real deviant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, duh. That's why we gotta catch him. Start hanging those.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aye, aye, Cap'n.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: More like, "Aye, aye, General."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Meredith parking the car] I don't think she's gonna make it. Don't think she's gonna make it - [metal scraping]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: It's a little too tight. I'm gonna find another spot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Many women are competent drivers. [scraping] OK. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [marks Scranton  with a red pushpin on a map of Pennsylvania and exhales] This is what we know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [in women's bathroom] Well, I stand corrected. This is pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, uh... where'd you decide to take Karen tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Anna Maria's.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What's the occasion?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Six-month anniversary. What?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Nothing - I think, uh, we all kinda thought you guys were just, like, hooking up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, we've been dating for six months.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Uh, she might mention an email that I wrote a while back, um -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, right. I remember that one. She read it to me. She said she's not really ready to date somebody in the office, but she really likes you as a friend.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I figured. It's cool. I don't - I wouldn't want to be in an office relationship anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Hope nobody's on a diet.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Thanks, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're welcome. You're welcome, you're welcome. OK. So, let's dish.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What do you want to dish about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Anything you guys want. This is your time. [everyone is silent or continues to eat, Michael exhales] Mm. What is a Pap smear? Or is it "shmear?" Like the cream cheese.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK. New topic. Kelly, how are things with Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Awesome. Um, awful, I mean. But, uh, sometimes awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What, um... what do you think of role-play?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, it can be fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah? Well, Jan has this schoolgirl fantasy.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: It's a pretty common one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I just... I feel uncomfortable wearing the dress.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: OK. I'm gonna be at the doll store.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Sometimes, the clothes at GapKids are just too flashy. So I'm forced to go to the American Girl store and order clothes for large colonial dolls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, you shouldn't do anything that you're uncomfortable with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jan says anything that doesn't scare us is not worth doing. I don't know. Maybe we're different people. I like cuddling and spooning and she likes videotaping us during sex.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [groans] And then watching it back right afterward to improve my form.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: That is not healthy behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it's not that bad. The worst part is that she shows it to her therapist and they discuss it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, you need to get out of this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, she's... she's fooling around. It's a woman thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, normal women don't do stuff like that. This is bad. [Karen nods and Michael looks like he's about to start crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No... No, it's all right. I'm OK. I'm OK. [sniffing] You guys... what are we gonna do about Jan? [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Read the pros first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. Jan is smart. Uh, successful. Good clothes. Hot. Perfect skin. Nice butt.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: She does have very nice clothes.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: OK, OK. Um, cons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cons. Wears too much makeup. Breasts: not anything to write home about. Insecure about body. I'm unhappy when I'm with her. Flat-chested.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What was the last one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She's totally flat. Shrunken chesticles.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No, the one before that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm unhappy when I'm with her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael... you shouldn't be with someone who doesn't make you happy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm happy sometimes. Um... when we scrapbook or right towards the end of having sex.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Look, most relationships have their rough patches. You just have to push through it sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, that's smart.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe. But it sounds like you're just wrong for each other.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That sounds good too. I don't know who's right. I just don't - I don't know. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I bet you know. Don't think, just answer. What do you want to do about Jan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I wanna break up with Jan. Wow. I wanna break up with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: My mom taught me that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow, I cannot believe this yogurt has no calories.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No one said it has no calories.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, hey, guys. I want to do something nice for you, because you did something so nice for me earlier. I want you to go in there. I want you to buy one item on me as a thank-you. [Kelly sprints inside Victoria's Secret] Come on. Get in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let's face it, most guys are from the Dark Ages. They're caveman. And they like a woman to be showing her cleavage and to be wearing 8-inch heels, and to be wearing, um, see-through underpants. But... for me, a woman looks best when she is just absolutely naked.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [in women's bathroom] This is so great, huh? We should do this much more often.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I-I think we hang out an appropriate amount of time.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: What are you doing in here? This is the women's room.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You're in here.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I pay for that privilege. [goes into stall]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [all get up to leave] OK.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [wearing headphones and speaking loudly] I'm a pretty normal guy. I do one weird thing. I like to go in the women's room for number two. I've been caught several times and I have paid dearly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm. You don't want anything? My treat. Some panties or... pick a thong or... G-string. T-back. Get a nice bra. Padded bra. See-through, push-up, lace? Thigh-high? Bustier? Any - it just - you know what, I would love to buy you a fresh set of underwear.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Phyllis. What do you think? Too much?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Jim's gonna love it. [Karen giggles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm kind of in-between boyfriends right now. So I don't need anything sexy. But I do need some new hand towels. I figure I can cut up this robe.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [in the car] Slower. Slower. Meredith. [Michael's cell phone ringing My Humps] Slow it up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh. Oh, no. [inhales sharply]  It's Jan. What do I do?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Answer it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't answer it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, it stopped.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [bang] Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [tires screeching] Crap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [snickers at Pam's sketch] That is pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Michael, you know how to, um -change a wheel, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, yeah. Yep. Um... Could somebody grab me the lever, and I will...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Here, uh... Meredith? Why don't you put your hazards on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, get your hazards on for safety. Let's see. [takes off his coat and tosses it aside] There we go! [Pam brings over the jack and lug wrench] Good. Yes, we have the... all right. [tries the use the jack to loosen the lug nuts]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think I've got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you have a... a crescent? A crescent Allan?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't think we really need that, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh... you know what? I'm going to... you take care of that. I'm gonna do traffic... detail.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You know, I changed a tire today. All by myself. This bathrobe's already coming in handy. [Meredith honking] Coming!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Think we'll find him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, I do. 'Cause justice never rests.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [pulls a candy bar from his coat pocket] Halvsies?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Wholesies. [snatches the candy bar]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Listen, man, I really appreciate you letting me shadow you today. I feel like I learned a lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Natch. [bites off a lot of candy bar]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yep. If you don't mind, I think I'll hang some of these posters around my neighborhood. Schools, post office, et cetera.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know, I may have underestimated you. You're not a total ass. [coughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, I am really going to do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good luck, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what? I need my girls with me. Pam, Karen, even Phyllis. Come on. Let's do this. Let's do it. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: OK, remember, be strong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love you guys.  Now I'm getting her voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't leave a -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [leaving a message] Hey, Jan. It's me, Michael. I'm just calling to say that I think we need a little break, permanently. And, uh, I know everybody says this, but I-I wanna remain friends. Or at least business associates who get along. Oh, just so you know, it's not me, it's you. [Jan walks in] OK, buddy. Somebody just walked in. I have to go. Um, so I'll talk to you later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael... [clears throat] I was, um... I was really unhappy with our conversation earlier. And I... I just - I couldn't stop thinking about it. So I decided that I would drive down here and apologize to you in person. So... [takes Michael's hand] I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: So... we're good?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Abso-fruit-ly.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [cell phone vibrates] Oh. Hold on, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No... No...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: One second. Oh! It's from you. Uh, you wanna grab some dinner?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: OK. [voice on phone] "It's me, Michael. I'm just calling to say that I think we need a little break, permanently. And, uh, I know everybody says this, but I want..."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Maybe some Italian. [voice on phone] "... to remain friends. Or at least business associates -" [Jan takes the phone away from her ear] Chinese? [voice on phone] "who get along. Oh, just so you know, it's not me, it's you. OK, buddy."

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Oh. [door closes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs] Any man who says he totally understands women is a fool. Because they are un-understandable. There's a wishing fountain at the mall. And I threw a coin in for every woman in the world and made a wish. I wished for Jan to get over me. I wished for Phyllis, a plasma TV. I wished for Pam to gain courage. I wished for Angela, a heart, and for Kelly, a brain. "Michael, how can you appreciate women so much but also dump one of them?" You mean, how can I be so illogical and flighty and unpredictable and emotional? Well, maybe I learned something from women after all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [phone rings] Dunder-Mifflin paper/sex predator hotline, this is Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight. It's Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, what are you doing? I'm busy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, you're not. I'm looking right at you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ugh. I'm hanging up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Don't. [quietly] I have information about the sex predator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You have information about the sex predator?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I saw him two minutes ago.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: In the women's bathroom, above the sink.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [hangs up and runs to the women's bathroom] Anti-flashing task force! Above the sink. Above the sink. Hmm. [sees himself in the mirror with two black marks on the mirror making a mustache, removes his glasses and figures it out] PAM!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: So how are you liking the Wall Street Journal subscription?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Love it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Are you reading it everyday, like we decided you would?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, yes, I am.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Good, good, it's the best business reporting isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, yeah, it's okay. Its just, I don't think the cartoons are very funny.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Wait, wait, what cartoons?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The a cartoon that goes with each article.  This one says Mel Karmazin?  I don't, I don't know. I guess I get it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [Sigh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We should really start recycling.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Right uh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hey, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Phyllis got flashed in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [Screams]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Okay, you need to stop that right now.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.line: Phyllis, you okay? You sure?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey good lookin', what ya got cookin'?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I got nothing cooking, it's cooked.  It's borscht and its served cold.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey listen, I'm sure everyone's already told you but, your presentation out there, was pretty inspiring stuff. Must be nice being a woman around here, knowing they have a protector in you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If you are trying to kiss my ass, I would not suggest it.  Believe me, you do not want to kiss this ass.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Borscht, according to Dwight it's best served cold.  You know what else is best served cold?  Yeah, gazpacho.  You see what I'm doing?  I am establishing a mutual love of cold soups.  This is the first step in my plan to win Dwight's trust.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I should make you my vichyssoise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I will never be your vichyssoise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Orgasms, why can women have them? Yep?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. I'm not a lawyer, but I don't think this is the place to do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sometimes I imagine what it would be like to be a woman.  I have a full-length mirror in my bathroom, and before I get dressed I will tuck myself between my legs just to see.  And, um, it's uncomfortable.  So maybe I do understand.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [sings] We're going to the mall.  Bye Ryan, bye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Lets go, fall out, let's go.  Move, move, move, move, move.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I got shotgun.  Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let me be clear.  There's only one thing that's important to me, and its not friendship.  Its dominance, and I think I know a thing or two about dominating.  Okay, I lived with a dominatrix for three years in Stamford.  Mistress Lila.  Taught me more than any college professor I ever had, while attending Cornell, which is where I went to school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look at that! Come on! Free underwear!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It is totally inappropriate, but on the other hand...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Pam, how bout something like that for you.  Could sort of cover up any imperfections in the mid section.  Just show off the twins a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You can make people believe anything.  Today I made Dwight believe I like cold soups.  Why?  I don't know.  I don't have to know.  That's what makes me so dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I learned a lot about women today.  And any man who says he totally understands women is a fool.  Because they are un-understandable.  Jan and I broke up. Why?  Because she didn't like one message I left on her voicemail?  But that is her peariagative.  I thought I understood women, but maybe, can't believe I'm gonna say this, maybe, women don't understand themselves.
